IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: PROMOTING COMMUNITY VOLUNTEER GOVERNANCE OF PUBLIC EDUCATION AND CONTINUOUS IMPROVEMENT OF STUDENT SUCCESS BY PROVIDING LEADERSHIP AND ASSISTANCE TO PUBLIC SCHOOL GOVERNING BOARDS.
IRS990.MissionDescription: PROMOTING COMMUNITY VOLUNTEER GOVERNANCE OF PUBLIC EDUCATION AND CONTINUOUS IMPROVEMENT OF STUDENT SUCCESS BY PROVIDING LEADERSHIP AND ASSISTANCE TO PUBLIC SCHOOL GOVERNING BOARDS.
IRS990.Description: ASBA SERVES SCHOOL BOARDS, SCHOOL DISTRICTS AND PUBLIC CHARTER SCHOOLS - AND THEIR BOARD MEMBERS. IN 2009, WE CONTINUED TO TRAIN SCHOOL BOARD MEMBERS, DELIVER POLICY SERVICES TO OUR MEMBER BOARDS AND SCHOOL ADMINISTRATORS AND ADVOCATED FOR OUR MEMBERS AND PUBLIC EDUCATION GENERALLY. FOR TRAINING, ASBA STAFF CONDUCTED OR FACILITATED 9 MAJOR CONFERENCES AND OVER 100 TRAININGS AND MEETINGS IN ORDER TO INFORM, EDUCATE AND BETTER PREPARE THESE BOARD MEMBERS TO DO THEIR JOBS AND SERVE THEIR STUDENTS. OUR POLICY SERVICES PROGRAM PROVIDED MODEL POLICY UPDATES, PERIODIC POLICY REVIEWS AND RESPONDED TO REQUESTS FOR INFORMATION ON POLICY IMPLEMENTATION AND APPLICATION FROM OUR SUBSCRIBERS. ASBA CONTINUES TO BE AT THE FOREFRONT IN ADVOCACY/PROMOTION OF PUBLIC EDUCATION IN ARIZONA THROUGH MEDIA OUTREACH, LEGAL INTERVENTION ON ISSUES OF STATEWIDE IMPORTANCE AND ACTIVE REPRESENTATION AMONG GOVERNMENTAL ENTITIES AT ALL LEVELS OF GOVERNANCE. THE PUBLIC AT LARGE IS EITHER DIRECTLY OR INDIRECTLY THE BENEFICIARY OF MUCH OF THESE EFFORTS. ASBA sponsors an Insurance Trust (ASBAIT) which provides competitive and affordable health insurance to member districts. Over half of ASBA members participate in the workman's compensation program (SCF Arizona) as part of the public schools pool.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.ReturnReference: Part XIII, Line 2d: Other expenses and losses per audited F/S
Part XII, Line 2d: Other revenue amounts included in F/S but not included on form 990
Part V, Line 4: Intended uses of the endowment fund.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Line 19: Other Organization Documents Publicly Available
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE ORGANIZATION'S FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE IN THE ANNUAL REPORT WHICH IS DISTRIBUTED TO MEMBERS AND ALSO IS AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST. THE ORGANIZATION'S GOVERNING DOCUMENTS AND CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY ARE AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST AND ON THE ORGANIZATION'S WEBSITE.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Line 15b: Compensation Review and Approval Process for Officers and Key Employees
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: PERFORMANCE EVALUATIONS, SALARY SURVEY COMPARISONS, RECOMMENDATION TO BOARD OF DIRECTORS BY THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE AND FINAL APPROVAL BY THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Line 12c: Explanation of Monitoring and Enforcement of Conflicts
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: INVITATION TO SPECIAL EVENTS ARE MONITORED THROUGH AN APPROVAL PROCESS BY THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Line 11: Form 990 Review Process
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: the organization's executive committee will review and approve the form 990 prior to filing.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Line 7a: How Members or Shareholders Elect Governing Body
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Officers of the Board of Directors are elected to one-year terms by the full membership at the ASBA Annual Meeting. County Directors are elected to two-year terms at the County Workshops.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Line 6: Explanation of Classes of Members or Shareholder
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The organization's members are Arizona school districts and their school district governing boards.
